column4: I've tried xvncviewer, vncviewer, and xvnc4viewer and none of them are logging in to any vnc servers, I do like, vncviewer 192.168.0.99:0 and it acts like it's logging in, and no screen ever pops up asking for a password. but in windows using realvnc I login just fine
: tells it to connect to port 0 and vnc is 5700 i think
what is the full command you enter?
have you made sure all the settings on the server are correct?
the vnc server might not be configured correctly
then that is the little bit of info we needed , huh?
this machine is the one with the messed up viewer, hence why I'm asking about it
didnt know if you had others, the viewer doesnt really have any config to mess up, thats why I thought it was the server.
next question, how is the box connected to the net?
fun, well there isnt any conf file for the viewer
all i can say is pop in the live cd and try it on that, if it works, its your viewer install, if not, network issues
could be a firewall issue  though, you have firestarter?
then the live cd is the test
with firstarter running, connect the viewer and look for the icon to turn red
if it turns red, it is blocking the request
well then, live cd it is
